website_summaries.verdict: Compact umbrella perfect for traveling, leaving in handbag or backpack.
cons: and smaller in size than anticipated

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Caution: I've used it only once. However, it opens like a charm, is beautifully constructed, closes equally easily and best of all, the canopy is designed such that it almost folds itself back up into its original shape--NO OTHER UMBRELLA EVEN COMES CLOSE! The only ding is that it is not quite as large a diameter as promised (could be the ordering process)--but not small enough to cause me to get out a measuring tape. Oh, and the cover is equally well designed and slips (not crams itself) over the umbrella. Where have these been all our lives!?!
customer_reviews.author: jowct

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Portable and somewhat hefty...
customer_reviews.text: Strong, Portable and slightly beefy (so could be used to club someone if necessary :). Jokes aside, this umbrella feels as though it's made to last. Opening, via the push-button release, feels like the spring-loaded mechanism could also be used as a pilot seat ejector. Only negative is that it's only really suited to one (small) person, so if your planning on traveling with family, buy at least three. Great stuff, look forward to my next rainy adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Stew

customer_reviews.title: Great umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: First thing I noticed was this umbrella has some weight to it. Not that it's heavy or anything, but you can tell its sturdy and well-made. I've used it a few times in the recent storms in California, and it's held up well. It did invert a couple of times during strong gusts of wind, but it flipped back easily and with no damage to the umbrella. I've had other push-button open/close umbrellas, but this one's push-button function is a lot smoother. I would definitely purchase this umbrella again, not only for myself but for my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent umbrella for traveling in any harsh weather
customer_reviews.text: This now well-tested umbrella is the bomb! I was in the Baltic region in late April and put this thing to the test. It held up extremely well in the battering winds in Estonia, Russia and Copenhagen. When you hit the open button the thing snaps to life like I've never seen before. It's light weight and compact, yet sturdy and strong. It's a great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: DannMann

customer_reviews.title: Not wind resistant at all
customer_reviews.text: Broke the second time I used it. The winds were only about 10 mph in NYC today.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Quinn

customer_reviews.title: VERY Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for trip to Scotland. Purchased because of auto open and close. You better be strong because once closed you have to push the top of the umbrella down to the handle to bring it back to compact size. I had to use a wall or the ground to push it down. Secondly, one of the stretcher arms broke right out of the gate after a few uses. So much for the high wind feature. I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia DuBois

customer_reviews.title: Construction is very durable.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Shipping was fast, the umbrella was well protected. 2. The umbrella is black is color and is 42 inch in diameter. 3. This umbrella has a button which opens and closes the hood. 4. Umbrella opens very quickly and closes very quickly unlike manual umbrellas. 5. Handle of the umbrella has a good grip. 6. Ribs seem very durable and sturdy. 7. Construction seems very durable. 8. The cloth used is very light weight and water resistant. Overall: I would recommend this umbrella. I got this product for a discounted rate in exchange for my unbiased review. If you found my review helpful, then please click the yes button below.
customer_reviews.author: Maheen

customer_reviews.title: doesn't close
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have ordered this umbrella. The first one was fine but heavy to carry. It was stolen from me in a restaurant in Europe. I ordered another one for a subsequent trip. Did not need to use it until recently and it is defective. Impossible to close to get into your car in the rain. You have to literally slam it against something hard to close it. Disappointed, as it was expensive and I have missed the window for exchange by a week. Faulty umbrella and you won't know until you are stuck in the rain and find out. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: jaycatz

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time used under moderate wind but heavy rain
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep on hand in my car in the rare event of rain here in SoCal, so when that moment finally came after a year of lying brand new dormant and my preparedness was about to pay off, that rare heavy rain and moderate wind caused one of the plastic supports to break. Wow.
customer_reviews.author: Auggie

customer_reviews.title: it's not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this umbrella with hopes that it would be better than the others that I purchased. I was wrong. when it arrived, it was raining outside. When I used it, it barely covered me, maybe my fault for expecting it to cover more than my head. However, I would not recommend this product to any one. I guess I will have to take my chances with the next one. No, I do not want a refund or another umbrella. Just very disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary White

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this umbrella in April of 2019, used it all of 3 times and I am so disappointed. The spokes are rusting, the entire umbrella is falling apart from the inside out. I thought I was buying the best, boy was I wrong. This was a total waste of my money. 3 months in and I am again looking for another travel size umbrella. Smh
customer_reviews.author: D. Love

customer_reviews.title: great overall quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my second LifeTek umbrella purchased in the last 4 years. The first was the standard travel umbrella with 1 canopy and was fine until the spring gave out recently. This time I went with the double canopy and the difference is significant. A stronger sprint mechanism and canopy make this a much better choice for windy weather. When compressed the unit is a bit thicker, but still fits in the bag comfortably...dries quickly. I recommend the double canopy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael  Clark

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy but that also means Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality umbrella. Very sturdy, opens and closes with precision. Love the slat on the top so that wind can pass through and protect it from inverting. Coverage is good. Downside for the sturdiness is that it is a bit on the heavy side. However, I'll gladly take the few extra ounces to have an umbrella that can (hopefully) stand up to stormy weather.
customer_reviews.author: Audiophile Headcase

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, works great.
customer_reviews.text: My senz umbrella broke because I dropped it on its head and that made the mechanism inoperable. I bought this because it was a good price, seemed sturdy and had good reviews. It has lived up to it quite well so far. It holds its own in a good windstorm and has good protection. It is not the lightest one however that is a sacrifice you will have to make for the sturdiness. I travel weekly and if fits in a tote bad, length wise, (which fits under the seat in front of me on an airplane)
customer_reviews.author: mccm

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable size, yet very durable!
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me, you've been looking for a small umbrella that is portable yet durable. This umbrella fits the bill. It accomplishes this by having a smaller stem (?) than most umbrellas I've purchased. Other than being able to fit this in my bag. the small size makes it easier to control the umbrella when the wind is going crazy. I find this umbrella blows out (reverses) in high winds way less than others. As for the handle, it's not one of the really cheap plastic types that'll break if you drop it, but it could be a little better. Nitpicking. Overall, excellent umbrella. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Shane D. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Broke quickly, Used Rarely
customer_reviews.text: I have barely used this umbrella, and today I opened it, the canopy didn't expand automatically, and I can barely get the thing to go back together. The umbrella won't stay open, and also is almost impossible to push the handle up to get it to go back together. Would not recommend. Jon
customer_reviews.author: Hot Wheels

customer_reviews.title: Great confusing christmas present
customer_reviews.text: Wrapped this for my GF for Christmas and put it under the tree. On christmas morning I opened up my stocking to find an unwrapped umbrella. I immediately think, "crap, I grabbed her stocking" then i realize that i put it under the tree not in her stocking. I try to figure out how i mistakenly moved it to her stocking and why is it unwrapped. This whole time I am silent and have a confused look on my face. She looks at me and says, "It's an umbrella" like I'm a moron. I promptly tell her unconvincingly that I know and hand her her present, which is shaped very similarly to my new umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Umbrella!!!
customer_reviews.text: With so many umbrella's out there, this is a very good compromise. I "Collected" umbrella's for awhile and have umbrella's that cost over $100 and umbrella's that cost as low as $10. This LifeTek compact umbrella is a perfect balance. Not too expensive and not too cheap where it would have functionality problems. The umbrella's that I got under $20 didn't last past the first use. This LifeTek model has a quality construction and feel to it in the handle and the overall construction. It looks pretty cool too! I just keep extra umbrella's in the cars in case those renegade showers hit's our area and this umbrella is now a permanent addition to our primary vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Sid

customer_reviews.title: Really great! Used it while walking in strong buffeting wind
customer_reviews.text: Really great! Used it while walking in strong buffeting wind, that endeavored to take umbrella out of my hand. It did not turn inside out as most do. It would shelter two average sized people as seens the normal size- yet it is compact & light for hand bag. Even better; the lashing rain just rain off it so as the inside of my car & home remained dry- the umbrella material was not soaking but dry. Sturdy great looking. Would like it in a dark charcoal as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Great compact umbrella that lasts!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I've ever owned an umbrella that lasted this long. Well worth the money. I've had this umbrella since 2015 now, and I carry it in my backpack daily and use it pretty much every time it rains. It's still going strong despite the rain and wind of NYC. It is a compact umbrella with a limited amount of coverage, which means that your legs will still get wet of it's windy enough or if it pours really hard. I wouldn't take this on a hike when the weather forecast says it's going to pour all day, but for my daily commute this is perfect and I'm seriously impressed by how well it's holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Very, very impressed with this
customer_reviews.text: I just spent 16 days carrying this around Germany, Czech Republic, Netherlands, and Austria. I used this in high winds in Amsterdam and a huge downpour in Munich. It's been on and off trains, planes, subways, trams, cabs, and Ubers, jammed into my luggage, and rattled around in my backpack. It came through it all like a champ. Overall, I could not be more impressed with the build and quality. This is a fantastic buy for the money. I plan to buy a few more to give away as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron W

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: It was a great umbrella while it lasted, but after 5 months it broke. The open/close mechanism failed, and of course couldn't be repaired. Umbrellas get a lot of wear and tear, and I don't expect them to last forever, but I had a bit higher expectation from LifeTek. Next time, I'll just purchase two cheaper umbrellas from Costco for the same price and see if I can get more than a combined 5 months use out them.
customer_reviews.author: Brad M.

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrated at literally the first strong gust of wind!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this several months ago and seldom used it. Brought it on vacation with me last month, and the first time I used it, within less than two minutes a gust of wind blew it inside out. Three spines snapped instantly. Having no other umbrella, I tried to continue using it, and over the next few days several more spines broke. The umbrella ended up in a trash can as soon as I could find a better replacement. Shocking to me how quickly it disintegrated. My only reason for the second star is that I did keep it for several months (barely used) before this happened.
customer_reviews.author: dr98765

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella is very high quality and excellently made. The automatic open/close works flawlessly. Looking at the mechanism under the fabric I can see this will last for years. The only reason for not giving it 5 stars is after you push the button to close it you cannot re-open the umbrella by pushing up on the center ring. You must compress it back to the closed position and then press the button. I am a train/bus commuter and sometimes find myself running from platform to platform or bus stop to bus stop. Manually reopening the umbrella is a must have for me on rainy days.
customer_reviews.author: mjpsammon

customer_reviews.title: Great umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: For years, I only used a certain brand's umbrella. Let's just say that certain brand doesn't make 'em like they used to. So I took a chance and bought this umbrella recently after reading other reviews. That turned out to be a great move. This umbrella is quite sturdy and performs great. It's not a compact size that would fit in a small bag, but rather a touch bigger. But I like it a lot. It has a wide coverage area. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jay in Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I use this umbrella for 1 month about 20 times and broke easily
customer_reviews.author: Yasutaka Ose

customer_reviews.title: Product began to rust at every hinged connector
customer_reviews.text: Great umbrella, sturdy but quite heavy. It was a Christmas gift for my wife in December 2018. We noticed recently that the fabric inside the canopy is stained by rust. Many of the hinged metal connections have begun to rust. Given that umbrellas are inherently designed to be used in the rain, this isn't an acceptable result of such use. My wife commutes and used the umbrella all through our wet winter. It is very sturdy and survived some tough wind conditions in the downtown city. But to find the unsightly rust stains and rusting parts means this product was not designed with long life in mind. We will have to replace it after 4 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, but returned one. It would not close properly. Some previous reviews mentioned the same problem. The 42" size is actually 37", and the 45" actually 40". Each is 5" smaller than the advertised size. Both umbrellas are a bit too heavy for international travel.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Yu

customer_reviews.title: Never be without a Travel Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Umbrellas, especially umbrellas designed for convenience and travel, are not a lifetime investment. I would say that this Life Tek umbrella is well designed, sturdier than most, and a bit eye catching. My only reservation is the problem of a folding shaft is never as sturdy as a solid one piece shaft. But, you can’t have it all ! I bought the umbrella for travel in tropical climes. I think it will do well
customer_reviews.author: Thank you love this book!!

customer_reviews.title: 2-year Lifespan with moderate use?
customer_reviews.text: I've carried it in my backpack for the most part, just about every day. After 2 years of moderate use, it has finally failed. The small external button that keeps water from flowing into the apex/center-top of the umbrella must have fallen off, and is now missing. I've taken good care of this umbrella, and had I noticed when that button had fallen off, I'd have tried to glue it back on. Is two years a good lifespan for an umbrella? Not sure - will likely try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Okayish Quality
customer_reviews.text: The handle is definitely sturdy, but the rest of Umbrella feels the same quality that you’d get from a drugstore or Staples. It certainly isn’t the most sturdiest and the coverage falls just short of shielding completely from the rain. Its a pity because the next size feels like a canopy in comparison and oversized — if this was just a tad bigger in coverage, it would have been great. The button sometimes causes the Umbrella to collapse as you are holding it, but easily fixed by re-closing and re-opening... not fun during rain. It certainly holds just a little more in the wind with rain here in NYC, but not much.
customer_reviews.author: Pankaj

customer_reviews.title: Rusting after second use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 umbrellas- 2 Umi brand and one Life Tek. I used the Umi for work ( mail carrier) and put the Best one (Life Tek) in my car for rainy days. Well the Umi started rusting and will not retract. So I was left walking in the rain delivering mail. So I had to use the Life Tek and after two uses it started rusting also.This is my fourth Life Tek umbrella. The others are the larger size and I haven't used but one of those, so I hope they don't rust like this compact one.
customer_reviews.author: CassB

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel in heavy rain
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this for a trip to NYC and Boston in April when the weather was expected to be very rainy. It's larger and more sturdy than my regular travel umbrella and I'm so glad I upsized to this one. It's slightly heavier than my tiny travel umbrella but it kept the rain off and didn't flip inside out in the wind like other people's umbrellas around me. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amy C.

customer_reviews.title: Inverted the first time
customer_reviews.text: First time I opened it the umbrella fully inverted with the wind, would not close properly, then finally once I got it closed And re opened it it continued inverting, would not stay open all the way (bounced a lot.) maybe I got a defective Umbrella because this had great reviews. I don’t know.
customer_reviews.author: Hollin Calloway

customer_reviews.title: If closing it doesn't matter, buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this LifeTek Windproof Double Canopy Travel Umbrella with auto open and close mechanism to have in my car in case of rain. When I needed it most, it opened fine, but it was impossible to close, remaining in the open position. I had to put it in the back of my SUV "open" so it would not be a flying missle in the storm. Why have it period? It was less than 5 months old and had been used maybe 3 times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big difference and Premium Quality.
customer_reviews.text: We have always purchased the cheap compact umbrellas in the past. They’re ok at best and tear up quickly. Lifetek umbrellas are premium quality and workmanship. You will notice immediately that these are high umbrellas. Purchased one and was so impressed I ordered another one. Steve Elrod
customer_reviews.author: Steve Elrod

customer_reviews.title: It's good, not great
customer_reviews.text: I understand that this is supposed to be light weight for traveling. But it was even smaller than expected. The handle is a little wobbly, but I haven't had any problems thus far. I bought another umbrella just to see if I could find something that covered me better from rain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality umbrella, worth the few extra dollars
customer_reviews.text: My last umbrella, I might have used it twice before two of the brackets were falling apart. If you're the kind of person that loses their umbrella every time it rains, don't bother. But if you've managed to keep a couple umbrellas until they're falling apart, however long or short that may be, you might want to consider paying a little extra for better quality. It's a compact design, but not quite purse size. It easily fits into the side pocket on my laptop back. The cloth material feel softer than most umbrellas, possibly from a tighter weave, or just nicer material. And the metal bits are thicker a more sturdy than a regular umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: ssbproductions

customer_reviews.title: Great Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: The true test of an umbrella is how it holds up on a windy day, so I waited to write this review until I had some first hand experience. The umbrella is well made, and did indeed handle all the windy conditions I've encountered so far. I carry it every day in an outside pocket of my backpack (intended for water bottles I believe) so the compact size makes this umbrella a good fit for me. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Silas

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on this umbrella, but somebody must have been lying!! I will never purchase this umbrella again. I thought I was purchasing a compact umbrella that would keep me covered during any rain storm. I found out this is not true of this umbrella. I am 5'8 and slender but this thing is a joke. This umbrella is for a kid not a grown-up.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Mims

customer_reviews.title: First Florida rainstorm
customer_reviews.text: Need an umbrella that can withstand a regular Florida summer rainstorm (NOT HURRICANE) JUST a regular ol' rainstorm? Don't buy this! $30+ and I got drenched with the slightest rain and wind. Look at the picture. No matter the direction it was held- it turned inside out.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Works Good But
customer_reviews.text: I have used the umbrella several times. It works but your still have to hold on to the small handle when out in the wind. Not just hold on but hold tight so that you do not drop or send in to the wind. It was very reasonably priced, has held together and I would buy it again. I will buy the full size next time.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Jones

customer_reviews.title: Did not last!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this umbrella for my granddaughter to take to college. The first day she tried ti use it, it would not latch to stay up! What a disappointment!! Should have been better quality!?!?!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Martin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I have owned, and lost or destroyed, many umbrellas. This is probably the best I've ever bought. It is small enough to carry in a briefcase or tote bag, but opens up to provide great coverage. It's curved rather than flat, so it provides perfect coverage for one person. Two people might have to walk in very close proximity, but the curved design also makes walking next to another person with a separate umbrella work really well. The material is soft, not that slick feeling material that is used for most umbrellas. It stands up to wind well, and opens and closes very quickly. I would definitely buy this one again (and will, when I inevitably lose this one).
customer_reviews.author: Attyin VA

customer_reviews.title: LifeTek travel umbrella is a Winner Scoring every day when used bu my Husband
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes the sturdy closure mechanism as well as the width of the canopy. ,Another top seller umbrella is not teflon repellent, has pin holes thruout and he was glad to get the Lifetek umbrella this year. A better future ahead of him!
customer_reviews.author: phillyma

customer_reviews.title: Worth it and good size
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought small umbrellas before for travel, but they were always too small when spread to be practical. Used this in FL when a hurricane was coming. We were on the outside of it. It lasted in the wind and covered both my friend and I comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Jami B

customer_reviews.title: Nice umbrella, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Felt compelled to commend LifeTek on their customer service. Was walking home in a very stiff Chicago wind last week when part of my umbrella snapped. It was still covered by Lifetek's 2 yr warranty so I shot them an email with a photo of the break and my Amazon order confirmation. Received a response in 2 hours and a replacement umbrella at my door 2 days later. They even sent me the newer model. Thanks LifeTek!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D. Lehrer

customer_reviews.title: Not Light Weight
customer_reviews.text: I expected the umbrella to be much lighter in weight since it was advertised as a travel umbrella. However after examining it, I found it probably has to be this weight to be windproof. The wind always bothers me when using a flimsy umbrella, so overall I am pleased. It opens and closes very easily. Probably the sturdiest umbrella I have used.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Last 8 months and then the top separated from the middle section.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rennie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but but not big enough.
customer_reviews.text: It's very high quality and the product seems capable of handling a near hurricane with aplomb. It's just not big enough. I am a large man and I need this thing to be bigger. I get wet when I use it and that really is a shame. It's not the products fault, like a said it's a tank, it's that I didn't realize it was for normal or smaller sized folk. Big and tall people should look elsewhere. If this company made a larger umbrella I would buy it as it stands now I have a $30 dollar sun shade.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Velcro Closure Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: The mechanics of the umbrella seem to work fine but the strap with the Velcro Closures stopped "sticking" the third time I used it. Will send it back.
customer_reviews.author: An avid Amazon user

customer_reviews.title: SOLID
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful. Used for first time today. Must say ease of opening and closing with touch of a finger is the best option I've ever seen. Let's not forget when it closes all water just runs off, doesn't stick to material. Heavy duty frame and great quality makes me want to buy another. Excellent choice for a compact umbrella. Won't fold up in wind either.
customer_reviews.author: BRAD BONNELL

customer_reviews.title: Proof is in the Pudding!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted in an umbrella. Medium weight, good grip handle, does exactly what it says it will do and feels solid. I have arthritis in my hands and wrists and I have no issues whatsoever opening or closing this umbrella. I live on the Redwood coast and endured three storms with pelting rain and wind in one week and the LifeTek held up with stamina. I received my umbrella in a box which I appreciated, I had ordered another brand's umbrella that arrived broken in a yellow package envelope.
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: They all wanted to claim dibs on it if it wasn't claimed and everyone was quite disappointed when I claimed it back
customer_reviews.text: I bought this umbrella and accidentally left it on top of the work fridge. People around the office then would borrow it and bring it back to the work fridge. They all wanted to claim dibs on it if it wasn't claimed and everyone was quite disappointed when I claimed it back. It's a very small, sturdy umbrella. It opens and closes with the button and is just well crafted. It took awhile to get over the "I can't spend over $10 on an umbrella" thing, but working in Chicago where I have to walk a half mile to the train, a good umbrella is easily worth the money. I'm quite happy with the purchase and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Thonus

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond thrilled with this umbrella. I've purchased seven of varying brands over the past three years and none have managed to live through more than one rainstorm before flipping inside out and ripping the canopy. I'm extremely pleased to say that this umbrella has made it through four rainstorms so far. It has flipped (high winds) but never ripped the canopy and always flipped back without damage to the metal pieces. I'll be purchasing another as a backup soon (I'm still a bit fearful - again, seven umbrellas in three years).
customer_reviews.author: JJ724

customer_reviews.title: This umbrella is perfect for one person use
customer_reviews.text: I recieved this product at a discount for my honest review. This umbrella is perfect for one person use! Easy open and close! Just press the button to open and press the button to close! Great quality not cheaply made like most umbrellas so the price I'd say is on point! I haven't been able to test it in actual rain yet but by the looks and feel of the material it's going to hold up just great! Also haven't been able to test in wind and as most umbrellas buckle in the wind this one seems as though it might stand it's ground, the metal is super strong. All around great umbrella so I would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine H. Roy

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST QUALITY TRAVEL UMBRELLA. PERIOD.
customer_reviews.text: I have used many travel umbrellas. The LifeTex Windproof Umbrella Compact is by far the best. Solid spines, ease of opening and closing and as good as a compact umbrella can be in the wind. This brand exceeds several others I've tried, all compact umbrellas are not created equal and LifeTek is the one.
customer_reviews.author: m k short

customer_reviews.title: Nice travel umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I haven't owned it long so I can't speak to durability, but the mechanism works impressively well. It's light weight and fits in my computer bag for travel, I don't even know it's there. I've never been an umbrella guy (ex-military, "what, are ya gonna melt?") but now I'm old and I don't like getting wet anymore. :P
customer_reviews.author: K. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good umbrella. Some room for improvement.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It looks great It is very small and compact. (I got the smaller size) The open/close mechanism is very cool and works flawlessly The cover to stow the umbrella in has a slit on top that makes it easy to put it away / take it out Cons: The handle feels a little wobbly / lose and i wish it were sturdier / didn't have so much wiggle room as you hold it
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Dry, performs well in wind, easy open/close
customer_reviews.text: I recommend purchasing the larger size to help avoid your legs from getting wet while walking or when it is windy outside. This umbrella has worked very well, even in the gusty winds of the Midwest. It easily opens with the push of the button and closes by pushing the shaft back down until it clicks. The umbrella is pretty compact while stored. I have yet to see this umbrella turn inside out in strong winds and it has done a nice job of keeping me dry. No complaints thus far.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyMike

customer_reviews.title: Easy to open and close, good size
customer_reviews.text: Definitely only good for one person but the coverage is plenty, material is strong, and its very easy to open and close. I liked that the cover has a slit because it makes it easier to put the umbrella back in after its been opened.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten Lindblom

customer_reviews.title: It was nice and dry when the meeting was over
customer_reviews.text: Fast dry umbrella. I had the chance to use it the day after I received it. It wasn't raining too heavy nor too light (yellow cloud in a satellite map). I sat the umbrella folded on the floor by a corner in the conference room for a meeting which lasted a little over an hour. It was nice and dry when the meeting was over.
customer_reviews.author: Yunyun Jiang

customer_reviews.title: Great, except that the measurements are across the arc of the umbrella, not the diameter . . . .
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great, lightweight umbrella. It's the best-made compact umbrella I've ever had. I feel very professional with it. My only problem is that they advertise these in sizes measured over the arc of the umbrella, not across the diameter, but they don't tell you that in advance, at least on Amazon. I got the smaller size expecting it to be larger, and it's just not quite big enough to keep my 5'2" self and my purse out of the rain. Still, a really nice umbrella. I'd definitely order this again, but I'd get a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Big Wave Betty

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: I love this umbrella! Its the perfect size and has a nice heftyness to it that really adds to the durability of it in strong winds. The fabric is very thick and its easy to shake all the water off once you are out of the rain.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ivey

customer_reviews.title: As advertised...
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, large choice of colors, operates as promised. Have one for each car’
customer_reviews.author: brian51

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this umbrella to use on a trip overseas but had perfect weather the entire time there. But did finally get to use it back at home. I have always purchased cheap umbrellas but finally took the plunge when I bought this one. I can only say I love it. Now we don't have a great deal of rain here but I have had enough opportunity to use it and I find it sturdy and solid. I use it for work as well as everyday use. It is fast and easy for me to pull out and be ready to use. I can feel comfortable to recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Mott

customer_reviews.title: Quality of umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I wished they had your type of umbrella several years ago. I really enjoy my umbrella especially because of the quality, durability and style. I look forward to buying other colors. Thank you so much and keep up the good work
customer_reviews.author: TAMARA DONOVAN

customer_reviews.title: Please buy....it is the best umbrella I've ever purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Umbrella! I live in Chicago and work in the loop and its ALWAYS windy. When its raining, you want to make sure it will work. The last thing you need to do is struggle with your umbrella while holding files or coffee or whatever you have in your hands. I haven't had any issues with this umbrella to date and will be purchasing another one as soon as I need one. Because I live in the city, size is important and this is the perfect size. I hate when people walk around with Golf umbrellas (is that necessary?). Anyways, it is a standard size umbrella and WELL WORTH the price.
customer_reviews.author: Becky BTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Top qulaity
customer_reviews.text: The umbrella it's fantastic! it feels and seems very sturdy, the double canopy works wonders, only thing I see as a "bad" thing, is that is a little big even folded, so is not exactly made to keep on a purse, but its a perfect umbrella nonetheless
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, it's turned inside out in the wind a ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, it's turned inside out in the wind a few times but none of the supports have broken. Unfortunately, the supports did start to rust soon after I bought it, which has left brown marks on the inside. Not a huge deal, but I would expect the metal parts of a rain umbrella to be more water-resistant. The button also seems to have gotten somewhat harder to press over time. Overall I'm not disappointed in my purchase, but could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Nejedly

customer_reviews.title: great umbrella for adults and kids
customer_reviews.text: convenient and sturdy medium-sized umbrella. Bought instead of a a more expensive name brand and works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: sawlman

customer_reviews.title: I was a little disappointed that it has such a short handle which forces ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed that it has such a short handle which forces me to keep the umbrella almost touching my head. It is also a little loose when i move it from left to right. If I knew that information than I would have purchased a longhandle and a higher quaint product to minimize the movement when moving left to right.
customer_reviews.author: The Joyce Clan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Two years later; handle has become wobbly and the umbrella has inverted on me several times in strong winds despite the vent. Still decent, not as great as I had hoped. Despite the wobbly handle, the opening and closing mechanism seems solid and continues to work perfectly. Original review: Solid and sturdy umbrella, wind vent appears to be very effective!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rosenquest

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Impressive umbrella right out of the box. It is well made and has a robust feel. I am mechanically inclined and very critical of poor workmanship. Close inspection of this umbrella provided that the materials and working parts all are of quality base and construction. It appears that it will last for a while. The customer service department is very attentive. I hope I never have to contact them but they seem to take pride in their product and care about customer satisfaction. I almost can't wait until it rains!
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: It never flipped!
customer_reviews.text: So I’m a NYC commuter and an umbrella is super important to me. I’ve gone through many umbrellas, a lot of brand names ones as well. This umbrella has never failed me. It has never ever flipped over in the rain. I mean the heavy downpours, the mini tornados, and the tropical storms, it’s never flipped. After a spring & summer the umbrella is holding up without any problems. Awesome umbrella!
customer_reviews.author: Ina F.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price! Anticipating years of use
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my computer bag at all times. As any Chicagoan can attest, the weather can change three times a day and one of those might be a windy rain storm. This umbrella is small enough to easily fit in my bag, yet large enough, and sturdy enough, to keep me dry during a howling Chicago cloudburst. The sturdiness is worth mentioning again. This umbrella held up in a whipping wind, keeping its shape and not turning inside-out. I like the auto retracting feature as well. I'd not experienced this before.
customer_reviews.author: @theCryptKicker

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one.- Love it. Bought another for my wife she also loved it.- We had several rainy days in South Fla. and these umbrellas have been tested and passed with flying colors.
customer_reviews.author: Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Best umbrella that I've had in this price range (who ...
customer_reviews.text: Best umbrella that I've had in this price range (who wants to pay any more than this for an umbrella anyway???). Great form and function, and the quality of the materials is definitely top-shelf for this price range. I left my first one on a tram in Amsterdam (luckily it only rained for a couple hours the rest of the week), after only using it once, and I bought a replacement as soon as I got back home! I can't yet speak to its longevity, but it definitely made a great first impression.
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: Handles the PNW
customer_reviews.text: As a resident of the Pacific Northwest, this umbrella has done well. I’m impressed with its sturdiness in wind, and it’s compact form. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: John Barbell

customer_reviews.title: Wind proof Compact travel umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Great compact size. The spring loaded mechanism is strong. Fully opens fast and closes fast too. Handle is comfortable for long walks under the rain.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Hinges Rust
customer_reviews.text: The hinges started to rust after moderate use, the umbrella still works fine but If I'm going to spend money on an umbrella I'd rather not have one that rusts
customer_reviews.author: chdgriff

customer_reviews.title: Holds up in heavy winds
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful. Used for first time today. Must say ease of opening and closing with touch of a finger is the best option I've ever seen.I’m impressed with its sturdiness in wind, and it’s compact form. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricey, but worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Hands-down the best personal sized umbrella I've ever used (besides golf umbrellas, etc.). I actually purchased this and left it behind at a store, literally the first day I used it. I had to decide if I wanted to spend another $30 for a new umbrella, or just get by with the cheap ones I've been using. I ended up buying another one just because it's that great of an umbrella. It's sturdy under the NYC wind, it feels solid, and the grip is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I am dry
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It's great in the wind and very quick to deploy/fold. It's lightweight and compact. It's just the right size for one person on a crowded street. It keeps me dry without poking anyone else's eyeballs. And the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: thedishesaredoneman

customer_reviews.title: This umbrella sucks
customer_reviews.text: I had it for less than a month. Used it a handful of times. It broke. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: AMU

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift, impressive quality
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my husband, since his old umbrella recently fell apart. He is very impressed with the quality of this product and the fact that although it's a travel umbrella, that it covers a far wider area than his previous one. The fact that it's coated and repels the rain is a great perk too. It is simply very well made and looks like it will last for a good long time. Highly recommended, no downside with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Dunn

customer_reviews.title: A Class Act
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella opens quite powerfully with the touch of a button, and closes compactly, although the button isn't intended to close the umbrella all the way. The interior is striking, with a black center shaft and nine black ribs that look a lot classier than the usual silver-toned ones. An additional feature I really like is the heft of the handle, and that it isn't circular, but instead slightly oval, which makes it fit the hand really comfortably. Although I've only owned it for a few weeks and haven't gotten to test it in a real downpour, I'd say it's the nicest umbrella I've probably ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: tessa22

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service, they stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.text: Umbrellas seem well made , I bought one for me and one for my wife. I’ve used mine several times with no problems, my wife’s umbrella was used in heavy wind and broke one of the ribs, after posting my review I was contacted by Life Tec the next morning to verify my address to send me a replacement umbrella, they stand behind their products, I would recommend them any day, I changed my rating from a 3 to a 5 because of their excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Randall L Everett

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to wind
customer_reviews.text: My last umbrella was of the $4 emergency-purchase variety. It got me through a few rainy days, but when it got windy, the top blew away and I was left holding the handle. So I decided to invest in a slightly more robust umbrella. I've only had this for a few months, but so far it's stood up to strong winds in California and Japan without breaking. The build seems sturdy, it dries quickly, and it's got a satisfying whoosh when it opens. As others have noted, it's a little heavy and tough to close, but that's no big deal for a hulking strongman such as myself. I have a good feeling about this one.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Easy release.
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. I love the way they quickly deploy. No tricky latches or releases. Just pull it back down when you're done. They also pack away nicely. I keep one in my computer bag. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Martinex

customer_reviews.title: Nice Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice umbrella that stands up to strong winds. Small when it is closed. The only thing I don't like is umbrellas that rapidly pop open when you hit the release button.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Strong Folding Umbrella with Larger than Average Canopy...
customer_reviews.text: • Strong • Large for travel umbrella • Opens and closes easily • Quality construction • folding size is a bit larger than I expected but small enough to fit in most bags
customer_reviews.author: Hertzair

customer_reviews.title: Nice....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son. When it arrived, I wanted it for myself. It's a very nice umbrella and it is not too big. It's just right.
customer_reviews.author: Yanka S Barnette

customer_reviews.title: Very nice umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I really like this umbrella. You push the button on the handle to open the umbrella and you push it again to close it. But to close the handle, you have to place the umbrella on the ground and push it shut. It's to hard to push by hand for me anyway. I've only used it twice with light wind and it held up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Margie Elrod

customer_reviews.title: very nice, well made
customer_reviews.text: very nice, well made... love the closing action, very handy when you have only one hand available; used a gold paint marker to put my name on the sheath and initials on alternate umbrella panels, this is one thing I don't want to be stolen...
customer_reviews.author: vvurdsmyth

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a few years, but only used it a dozen times and it no longer locks and is therefore effectively useless to me as a portable travel umbrella...disappointing because appearance is nice and I was initially satisfied. Wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rainy McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: Great umbrella
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella is much better than the ones you might get a most sporting goods stores...Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Phil, LA

customer_reviews.title: my favorite umbrella yet
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of paying for cheap umbrellas which broke or rusted or leaked. My new LifeTek umbrella is so sturdy, dries quickly, and fits really comfortably in my hand. It arrived exactly on time. It's a little heavier than I'd prefer, but I'd gladly trade a little more weight in my bag for the protection it provides!
customer_reviews.author: Francis John Jue

customer_reviews.title: Solid umbrella for a windy city
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella sports an unusually strong shaft and stretchers. The first moment I opened it - wind blew it inside-out, and while I mentally wished RIP for my new umbrella - it survived, with flying colors. Excellent workmanship
customer_reviews.author: Hrundel

customer_reviews.title: 3rd purchase of this type of LifeTek umbrella.
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and function of it. I'll keep buying these quality umbrellas over and over again as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Tygr

product_meta.title: LifeTek Umbrella Double Vented Windproof Travel Umbrella Fast Dry Teflon Canopy Portable & Strong FX2 (Black)
feature_bullets: TRAVELER 45 FX2 BLACK DOUBLE CANOPY AUTOMATIC TRAVEL UMBRELLA: The Traveler 45 FX2 is a double canopy version of our top rated large collapsible umbrella that delivers superior wind resistance and is styled for both men and women. The auto open mechanism makes it fast and easy to open the umbrella before the rain starts to fall. A new “easy-fit” storage pouch makes it easier to insert the umbrella into the storage case after use.

BUILT STRONG TO FIGHT THE WIND: Wirecutter says "This model impressed us in our tests... it withstood being battered by violent gusts without ever inverting, ranking as one of the strongest umbrellas we have ever tested, and when we did force it to invert, the canopy snapped back into place without much effort.” The new double canopy wind-tech frame combines strength and flexibility to deliver superior wind resistance in a lightweight, highly portable design.

KEEPS YOU DRY + UV SUN PROTECTION: We exclusively use our signature red 210T micro-weave fabric to create the compact foldable 45-inch arc canopy, which delivers superior strength and is treated with Teflon water proof treatment with quick-dry technology. For sun applications, a best in class UV protection rating of UPF 60+ blocks over 97% of the sun’s damaging UV light rays.
DIMENSIONS: Closed Length: 12 in., Open Length: 25 in., Big Canopy Arc: 45 in., Coverage Diameter: 39 in., Weight 17 oz.
COMMITTED TO YOUR SATISFACTION & PEACE OF MIND - Every LifeTek umbrella comes with a two year "Peace of Mind" replacement guarantee against defects in our premium materials and quality workmanship.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,421 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
